alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 9:33AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Washington, Pleasants, northwestern Ritchie and northeastern Wood Counties through 1000 AM EST... At 932 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Parkersburg, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Marietta, St. Marys, Vienna, Williamstown, Belmont, Boaz, Newport, North Hills, Willow Island, Maxwell, Schultz, Arvilla and Waverly. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 174 and 186. Interstate 77 in Ohio near mile marker 1. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 7 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
